posts.title: Some ideas for the next version of Basie.
Some More Books I have Read in October
The Rebel Sell: Why The Culture Can't Be Jammed by Joseph Heath and Andrew Potter
Black Like Me by John Howard Griffin
The Great Betrayal: Fraud in Science by Horace Freeland Judson
Don't Eat This Book: Fast Food and the Supersizing of America by Morgan Spurlock
The Paradox of Choice: Why More Is Less by Barry Schwartz
The Art of Urban Cycling by Robert Hurst
Rats: Observations on the History & Habitat of the City's Most Unwanted Inhabitants by Robert Sullivan
The Ruby in the Smoke by Philip Pullman
Havoc, in Its Third Year by Ronan Bennett
How Wal-Mart is Destroying America and The World and What You Can Do About It by Bill Quinn
Pearls in Vinegar: The Pillow Book of Heather Mallick
Bitten: True Medical Stories of Bites and Stings by Pamela Nagami, M.D.
The Bone Woman: A Forensic Anthropologist's Search for Truth in the Mass Graves of Rwanda, Bosnia, Croatia, and Kosovo by Clea Koff
Beating Back the Devil: On The Front Lines with the Disease Detectives of the Epidemic Intelligence Service by Maryn McKenna
Girls' Own: An Anthology of Canadian Fiction for Young Readers by Sarah Ellis
How We Can Save The Planet by Mayer Hillman
Blessing of a Skinned Knee: Using Jewish Teachings to Raise Self-Reliant Children by Wendy Mogel
